
There are two types of animals found at Thapar University, Dogs and monkeys. Every month corresponding to every old dog, a new dog and corresponding to every monkey, two new monkeys are seen in the campus.
Given the month you have to find out the total numbers of dogs and monkeys in the campus. In month 0, there is a single dog and a single monkey in campus.


Input
 The first line of the input contains an integer T denoting the number of test cases. The description of T test cases follows. 

Each test case will contain a single number N, the month for which you need to find the total number of dogs and monkeys in Campus.


Output

For each test case, output the sum of total number of dogs and monkeys in the campus. As the sum can be very large, output answer after taking modulus 10^9+7 


Constraints

 0 < T < 1000
 0 <= N <= 10^9


Example
Input:
2
1
3

Output:
5
35
Â
